Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • Window
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Window
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This is the main class to run the program. It contains the main window and methods to run the game
    Version:
    v4.0 June 12th, 2014
    Author:
    Jason P'ng, Aakash Mali
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Window

        public Window()
        Constructor for the window.
        Parameters:
        JPanel - gamePanel the panel that contains the information panel and gameEngine used to play the game.
        JPanel - menuPanel the panel used to contain panels for the main menu.
        GridLayout - layout the layout used for the game panel and menu panel.
        JPanel - StasisPanel the panel for delaying the user and prompting to start the game.
        JPanel - LogoPanel the panel the contains the Down to Earth Games logo for the main menu.
        JPanel - InstructionsPanel the panel that displays the game instructions.
        JPanel - FormulaPanel the panel that displays physics formulas.
        JPanel - CorrectPanel the panel displayed for correct answers.
        JPanel - WrongPanel the panel displayed for wrong answers.

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        Implemented method of the ActionListener interface. Adds function to the menuitems and buttons across several panels.
        if statement distinguishes between different action commands
        if (answer == true) - Check if the use answered correctly.
        if (option == JOptionPane.YES_OPTION) - Checks if the user confirms to clearing the highscores
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ActionEvent - ae the action that triggers this method to be called.
        String - command the actionCommand of the action event.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the printing method is unsuccessful.

      • print

        public void print()
        Prints out the highscores.
        for loop traverse through highscores to queue them and print them
        Parameters:
        Printer - p the object that accesses the printer and prints.

      • show

        public void show(java.lang.String panel)
        helper method to switch between panels in card layout
        Parameters:
        String - panel the panel to be shown

      • namePrompt

        public void namePrompt(int location)
        Method to prompt the user to enter a name when they achieve a new high score.
        Parameters:
        int - location The ranking of the user's score.

      • runProgram

        public void runProgram()
        The main method for running the program
        while (true) - the loop for running the program until exited.
        for (int x = 0; x < 3; x++) - loop for three levels of the game.
        if (e.isTerminated ()) - Checks if there is a call to exit the game.
        if (loc > -1) - Checks if the user has a new highscore.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if Thread.sleep() interrupts another thread.

      • showQuestion

        public void showQuestion()
        Method to display a new question.

      • setAnswer

        public static void setAnswer(boolean newAnswer)
        Mutator method to set the state of the answer variable
        Parameters:
        boolean - newAnswer the value that answer is set to.
